Title: Enhanced Transformer Model: A New Frontier in Diabetic Retinopathy Classification
Abstract: transformer networks have revolutionized the field of natural language processing and computer vision. the self attention mechanism embedded in transformers help the model to weigh the importance of different elements in the input sequence when making predictions. however the computational complex ity of large transformers is substantially high. in this research paper we present a novel automated diabetic retinopathy  dr  grading system that utilizes the power of vision transformer networks augmented with an enhanced multiheaded self attention  msa  mechanism. the proposed system designed to analyze fundus images leverages the vision transformer self attention mechanism to focus on relevant features thereby facilitating accurate and efficient dr grading. furthermore the incorpo ration of the enhanced msa network not only maintains the interpretative benefits of the original self attention mechanism but also significantly optimizes computational efficiency. this optimization renders the system well suited for real world clinical applications where both accuracy and speed are paramount. encouraging results are obtained with the proposed solution demonstrating its potential as a valuable tool in the field of medical imaging and diagnostics. this work contributes to the growing body of research that seeks to bridge the gap between advanced machine learning techniques and practical healthcare solutions.
